newsitem.title: UK: UK MPs approve EU membership referendum plan.
newsitem.headline: UK MPs approve EU membership referendum plan.

text.p: Parliament on Tuesday technically approved an application by a Conservative MP for permission to bring in a bill to allow Britons a referendum on whether the country should remain a member of the European Union.
But Eurosceptic Teresa Gorman lost an opportunity to demonstrate the depth of opposition to the EU within the ruling Conservative Party when the measure passed without any MPs opposing it.
The vote on the issue was called off by speaker Betty Boothroyd when no members of parliament offered to act as tellers to count MPs voting against it.
Gorman's bill has no chance of making any further progress in parliament. But Conservative parliamentary business managers had feared that party splits over Europe would be reopened by a vote on it.
Introducing her proposed bill, Gorman said that European Union directives were disrupting and in some cases destroying small businesses in Britain.
